page.title: 15SHOTTS AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: The ambulance station is situated on the Benhar road. It runs 9 ambulances,manned by 18 drivers. In the past drivers have had 9 weeks training,but in future they will undertake a three year course. The vehicles are normally single manned,but when treatment is needed for patients in transit a second man is available. The job is stressful,especially when children are involved in accidents. The men have maternity training and it does happen that they sometimes have to assist at unscheduled arrivals. Older people are more appreciative of the service given than the younger,and are less likely to make unnecessary demands for ambulances.Vehicles carry life support equipment and Enteronox analgesic gas for relief of pain.
